entry.title: The School Organisation (Foundation Special Schools) (Application of Provisions Relating to Foundations) (England) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: Section 21 of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 (“the Act”) defines the different kinds of foundation and voluntary school, and the different kinds of foundation which may exist for the purposes of education legislation.

entry.title: The Firearms (Sentencing) (Transitory Provisions) Order 2007
entry.summary: Section 51A of the Firearms Act 1968 provides for minimum sentences to be imposed for certain offences under section 5 of that Act (“a qualifying offence”). Section 51A provides that an offender aged 18 or over when convicted of a qualifying offence for which a sentence of imprisonment is imposed will receive a minimum term of five years.

entry.title: The Health and Safety at Work etc. Act 1974 (Application to Environmentally Hazardous Substances) (Amendment) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: The Health and Safety at Work etc. Act 1974 (Application to Environmentally Hazardous Substances) Regulations 2002 (“the 2002 Regulations”) extend the reference to dangerous substances in section 1(1)(c) of the Health and Safety at Work etc. Act 1974 (“the 1974 Act”) to include environmentally hazardous substances. The purpose of the 2002 Regulations is to enable regulations to be made under section 15 of the 1974 Act to implement the Directives referred to in regulation 2 of the 2002 Regulations.

entry.title: The School Governance (Parent Council) (England) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations set out the arrangements for the composition, role and support of the parent council. Under section 23A of the Education Act 2002 (as inserted by section 34 of the Education and Inspections Act 2006), the governing body of a “qualifying school” (as defined in subsection (1) of section 23A) must establish a body to be known as a “parent council”.

entry.title: The Whole of Government Accounts (Designation of Bodies) Order (Northern Ireland) 2007
entry.summary: This Order designates bodies, for the financial year ending with 31st March 2007, for the purposes of section 15 of the Government Resources and Accounts Act (Northern Ireland) 2001. The Department of Finance and Personnel (“the Department”) intends to pass the information provided by bodies designated in the Schedule to this Order to HM Treasury for use in the preparation of the Whole of Government Accounts (WGA). The designation enables the Department to require those bodies to provide financial information in relation to that year.

entry.title: The Designation of Schools Having a Religious Character (Independent Schools) (England) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order designates the independent schools named as having a religious character.

entry.title: The Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (Commencement No. 10 and Saving) Order 2007
entry.summary: Article 2 of this Order brings into force on 30th June 2007, in relation to Wales, the following provisions of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004—

entry.title: The Social Security, Housing Benefit and Council Tax Benefit (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Social Security (Claims and Payments) Regulations 1987, the Council Tax Benefit Regulations 2006, the Council Tax Benefit (Persons who have attained the qualifying age for state pension credit) Regulations 2006, the Housing Benefit Regulations 2006 and the Housing Benefit (Persons who have attained the qualifying age for state pension credit) Regulations 2006.

entry.title: The School Organisation (Requirements as to Foundations) (England) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations set out the requirements to be met in relation to the foundations of foundation and foundation special schools to which section 23A of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 (“SSFA 1998”) applies. For these purposes, a foundation is a foundation established otherwise than under SSFA 1998: it is not a “foundation body” as defined in section 21 of SSFA 1998. They also provide for the Secretary of State to have certain powers in relation to the charity trustees of such foundations.

entry.title: The Collaboration Arrangements (Maintained Schools and Further Education Bodies) (England) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations enable governing bodies of maintained schools and further education bodies to develop joint working arrangements and, if they wish, to delegate the exercise of their functions to one or more joint committees.

entry.title: The Export Control (North Korea) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order is part of the United Kingdom implementation of United Nations Security Council Resolution 1718 (2006) (“UNSCR 1718”), which imposes restrictions on trade with the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea. The Council of the European Union has adopted a Common Position (Council Common Position 2006/795/CFSP – “the Common Position”) in response to UNSCR 1718. Council Regulation (EC) No 329/2007 (“the Regulation”) implements the elements of the Common Position that fall within Community competence.

entry.title: The Jobseeker’s Allowance (Extension of the Intensive Activity Period) Amendment Regulations 2007
entry.summary: Sections 19 and 20A of the Jobseekers Act 1995 provide that jobseeker’s allowance may not be payable to a claimant who refuses or fails without good cause to take part in an employment programme when directed to do so. The term “employment programme” is defined in regulation 75(1) of the Jobseeker’s Allowance Regulations 1996. One of the programmes referred to in that regulation is the Intensive Activity Period.

entry.title: The Community Legal Service (Asylum and Immigration Appeals) (Amendment) Regulations 2007

ukm:Subject.Value: LEGAL SERVICES COMMISSION, ENGLAND AND WALES

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Community Legal Service (Asylum and Immigration Appeals) (Amendment) Regulations 2007

category.term: LEGAL SERVICES COMMISSION, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Community Legal Service (Asylum and Immigration Appeals) Regulations 2005 (“the Principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The Veterinary Surgery (Artificial Insemination) Order 2007
entry.summary: Articles 2 and 3 of this Order, which apply in England only—

entry.title: The Legal Aid (Asylum and Immigration Appeals) (Northern Ireland) Regulations 2007

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Legal Aid (Asylum and Immigration Appeals) (Northern Ireland) Regulations 2007

entry.summary: These Regulations make provision about the exercise in Northern Ireland of the powers in section 103D(1) and (3) of the Nationality, Immigration and Asylum Act 2002, as inserted by section 26(6) of the Asylum and Immigration (Treatment of Claimants, etc.) Act 2004 and amended by section 8 of the Immigration, Asylum and Nationality Act 2006.

entry.title: The Tax Credits (Definition and Calculation of Income) (Amendment) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These regulations amend the Tax Credits (Definition and Calculation of Income) Regulations 2002 (S.I. 2002/2006) (“the 2002 Regulations”) to take into account the coming into force of the Income Tax Act 2007 (c.3) and the introduction of the Assembly Learning Grants and Loans (Higher Education) (Wales) Regulations 2007 (S.I. 2007/1045 (W.104)).

entry.title: The Scottish Parliamentary Elections (Returning Officers' Charges) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order makes provision for the payment of constituency and regional returning officers for their services and of their expenses at elections for membership of the Scottish Parliament.

entry.title: The Landfill (Amendment No.2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007
entry.summary: The Regulations amend the Landfill Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003 (‘the 2003 Regulations’) and the Waste Management Licensing Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003.

entry.title: Salaries (Comptroller and Auditor General) Order (Northern Ireland) 2007
entry.summary: This Order provides for an increase in the annual salary payable to the Comptroller and Auditor General following recommendations made in the Report of the Review Body on Senior Salaries in 2007 (HMSO CM 7030).

entry.title: The Local Authorities (Functions and Responsibilities) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Local Authorities (Functions and Responsibilities) (England) Regulations 2000 (“the 2000 Regulations”). They apply in relation to local authorities in England.
